sen.j: 供御方（くごかた）とは、室町幕府において征夷大将軍及びその家族の供御（食事）を調進する役職。
sen.e: Kugokata (供御方) is a position in charge of preparation and service of the meals to Seii taishogun (literally, 'great general who subdues the barbarians') and his family in Muromachi bakujfu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 供御方→Kugokata. 統一用語リストkugokata (an officer of kugosho, the meal bureau for shogun, who serves daily meals to shogun)のカッコ内は省略しました。
sen.e: Kugokata was a position in charge of preparation and service of meals to the Seii taishogun and his family in the Muromachi bakujfu.
"Kugokata" was a position in charge of preparation and service of meals to the seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") and his family in the Muromachi bakufu.
sen.cmt: 統一リスト（その他 2009/6/29）の指示により、Kugogata にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。征夷大将軍the Seii taishogun をthe seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") に修正しました。bakujfu を bakufu に修正しました。

sen.j: 足利将軍家の日常の雑務の世話をする御末衆の中から選ばれた。
sen.e: Those in this position were pick up from the lowest-ranked officers taking care of daily miscellaneous chores for Ashikaga (Muromachi) shogun family
sen.cmt: 御末衆→定訳不明：lowest-ranked officers taking care of daily miscellaneous chores (for a shogun family) としました。
sen.e: Those in this position were picked from the lowest-ranked officers taking care of daily miscellaneous chores for the Ashikaga (Muromachi) shogun family.
Those in this position were picked from osueshu, the lowest-ranked officers taking care of daily miscellaneous chores for the Ashikaga (Muromachi) shogun family.
sen.cmt: 御末衆の読み (osueshu) を追記しました。

sen.j: 『武家名目抄』によれば、太田氏・進士氏の世襲の職とされているが、進士氏が年始の式三献など恒例行事の供御を務めた例はあるものの、次のような記事が見られるため、供御方そのものは必ずしも特定の氏の世襲ではなかったと考えられている。

sen.j: 文正元年（1466年）の将軍足利義政の飯尾之種亭訪問の際には御末衆全員で供御の任にあたったことが記されており、他の記録でも疋田氏・下津屋氏など他の御末衆が供御方を務めた記事が見られる.
sen.e: There is a record that in 1466, when Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA visited the residence of Yukitane IINOO, all the lowest-ranked officers were engaged in the preparation and service of the meal to shogun, and also there is another record containing articles that other clans such as the Hikita clan, Shimotsuya clan and others others took charge of Kugokata.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。飯尾之種亭→「亭」は「邸」と解釈しました：the residence of Yukitane IINOO
sen.e: There is a record that in 1466, when Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA visited the residence of Yukitane IINOO, all the lowest-ranked officers were engaged in preparation and service of the meal to shogun, and also there is another record that mentions that other clans such as the Hikita clan, Shimotsuya clan and others others took charge of Kugokata.

There is a record that in 1466, when Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA visited the residence of Yukitane INO, all the lowest-ranked officers were engaged in preparation and service of the meal to shogun, and also there is another record that mentions that other clans such as the Hikita clan, Shimotsuya clan and others took charge of Kugokata.
sen.cmt: 飯尾之種Yukitane IINOO を Yukitake INO に修正しました。Shimotsuya clan and others others took charge of Kugokataの others を一語削除しました。
